text: hi I'm Alan straw and welcome to my
cupcake addiction where today I'm going
to be showing you how to make these
gorgeous little no baked watermelon ice
cream bowls I love how simple these are
these are perfect for summer and they're
so so easy let's get started the things
that you'll need to recreate your
watermelon ice cream bowls we've got
some good quality strawberry ice cream
I've got some little water bombs or tiny
tiny little water balloons I've got a
small spoon of a large spoon a spatula a
skewer I've got some duck
candy melts and then I've got some that
I've liked and so to make those I've
used just green candy melts for the
darker candy melt and then I've used a
combination of white chocolate and green
candy melt about a 50/50 ratio for that
lighter green I've got some pink food
coloring I've got some chocolate chips a
spare Bowl and I've also got a tray with
some wax paper the first thing we want
to do is you want to take some of that
lighter green candy melt and we're going
to put like 40 spoonfuls of it just
resting on the top of your darker green
kind of evenly so 1 2 and then your
third and then 4 all right so I want to
take my first little water balloon that
I've already blown up now I will mention
here you want to make sure that your
candy melts are melted but they're not
hot anymore so you want to let them sit
on the bench for about 10 or 15 minutes
once you've melted them to make sure
that they're relatively close to room
temperature so you don't pop your water
balloons and end up with a chocolate
explosion take your balloon now and just
dip it straight in in the center of your
candy melts and give it a little twist
which is going to give it that really
nice cut of watermelon skinny tight look
place it straight down into your baking
paper but don't push down too hard here
and that's going to give it a nice
little foot so your watermelon doesn't
roll around repeat that process with all
of your watermelons and you may need to
add in a little bit more of that lighter
green candy melt so that you continue to
get that nice variation in color places
into the fridge to set and then you want
to take your strawberry ice cream so
mines been out softening on the bench
for about half an hour or so so it's
nice and soft but it's not completely
runny and I'm just going to scoop about
half of that into a bowl because it's
not quite pink enough for how
think I wanted I'm going to add a little
bit of just pink food coloring and stir
it through a beautiful vibrant pink
really offsets the green of your
watermelon bowls
grab your balloon bowls from the fridge
and I really shouldn't take too long to
set and then you want to take either a
skewer or a toothpick and just pop the
water balloon now
when you pop those you want to make sure
that you take out all of that balloon
membrane it should peel out quite easily
from the inside of your watermelon bowls
do make sure you've got all traces of
that water balloon out of your chocolate
bowls to make sure that none of your
guests are going to accidentally eat any
because I've only done one thin layer of
chocolate I've got a little hole in the
bottom of each of my bowls when I pulled
out that membrane don't worry you just
want to take a little spoonful more of
your melted chocolate or melted candy
melt and just spoon it in the base to
create a little plug to make sure
they're completely watertight take your
beautiful bright pink ice cream and I'm
just spooning it in all the way up to
the rim so that you've filled all three
of your half watermelon bowls with that
beautiful watermelon looking ice cream
and then it's as simple as just taking
some of those little chocolate chips and
positioning them around to look like
watermelon seeds because these are round
and they're not kind of that overly
shape of the seeds I just took a skewer
toothpick and just to push them in so
they're kind of lying on their sides and
you can only see sort of halves of them
poking up and none of those little
pointed tips those ones need to go back
off into the freezer until that ice
cream is completely reset so there
you've got your absolutely adorable
fully edible little ice cream watermelon
bowls I hope you guys have enjoyed this
video I hope that I'll see lots of these
getting around if you do make them I'd
love it if you'd share photos with me on
either my Pinterest or my Twitter or my
Facebook I will leave links to them in
the description box below and as always
thanks very much for tuning in to my
cupcake addiction
